Game is good for entry level players like myself, but this game is so fuckin boring now everyone plays the same. I noticed that literally every sol player plays the exact same, like they literally found the same guide on the internet and all follow it religiously, its honestly really pathetic. I guess that's the nature of fighting games but holy fuck you guys are fucking losers.

Don't get me wrong this game was pretty awesome and a great intro to fighting games, and learning the game was the best part, but after getting to the higher floors, every game is the exact same. I've gotten to the celestial floor, and could barely hang up there, literally getting only 1 win before the season reset. I haven't been able to get back there, but I am still a consistent 7-10 floor player. I found (in my experience) that the lower the floor, the more fun the games are. Not necessarily because the opponents are worse, but because there is a very clear difference in their play style. Most players on floors 7 and 8 are playing from experience, and often don't know the optimal combos and they play from what they know, which if you are anything like me, feels good to play against and feels like a genuine game. However, once you get above floor 8, you can tell that those players are just try-hards who look up the craziest combos on reddit, and will just play footsies with you until they can pull off those combos. Those games are just straight boring, and don't feel fun to play against, like if I wanted to play against a mindless robot that pulls off the same moves over and over, I'd play against a bot. Those are the biggest gripes I have with this game, and probably fighting games in general.

Game overall is great if you can overlook the repetitiveness of the higher floors. Best things i can say about this game is that the art style is pretty dope, music is absolutely bitchin, and its a great game to start with fighting games, but once you've gotten 100 games you've seen it all.

Also Faust and potemkin are the best characters no doubt.

Guilty Gear Strive!
It's a 2d fighting game, think Street Fighter, Marvel vs Capcom, King of Fighters. Don't think Soul Calibur, Dead or Alive, and especially don't think Tekken.
There's a few 2d fighting games out there, and I think it's fair to ask of any of them, (especially one that's as expensive as Strive is at potentially $80 USD) "What sets this game apart from others in the genre"
In my opinion, what sets Strive apart is how incredibly easy it is to learn. I have played almost none of the games I mentioned earlier. I didn't think I liked fighting games besides casually enjoying Super Smash Brothers (which is a very different game). Strive proved me wrong. 
The most "special moves" (read: moves with strange inputs like quarter circles) any character you pick is going to have is like, 10. A lot of the "normal" moves have universal properties, so you can pick up a character and have a good idea of what each button should do once you have somebody figured out. Each character plays very uniquely, sure there are categories of character, but I feel even characters in the same category tend to feel very different to play. 
I really like this game for its elegance, though I must note a few of my friends got into it at the same time I did, which really helped with the learning curve and fun value. I wasn't getting stomped by people who already know everything about the game.

Ok so i have a certain take when it comes to fighting games because of me growing up with MK and having that feeling of dedicating your time to learn your character and find your playstyle. I like my fighters characters/game to be fun,unique,have a good soundtrack,SFX,Etc. And Strive brings everything to the table for me in a fighter and much more in my opinion. This is my first Fighter ive bought in years that i actually enjoy. I played DBFZ (Dragon Ball FighterZ) for years and it got really boring for me after a year or two because of how simple it was. Guilty Gear Strive does not feel that way after putting 100 hours into and i already dedicated a lot of time to a few characters in the roster which was something i never did with ArcSys DBFZ i always play the same characters because they were the meta in the game but here in GGS there is a meta but it feels like every character is viable and suits a play style you would like. Every character plays,sounds,and looks beautiful!!! the whole game is GORGEOUS!!! the graphics look amazing and the soundtrack OH MY LORD the soundtrack is all BANGERS i had all the OST on repeat when i played this game day 1 and each song matches each characters overall theme,look,and even backstory and lore which had me interested enough to buy the last installment of the series since ive heard of this series before i can not stress enough how much i love the characters themes and theme of the game i might even get the soundtrack on vinyl because its that good trust me give the OST a listen you will not regret it. Im very casual when it comes to fighters but this game makes me wanna dedicate more time to it because of the fun gameplay which is not easy but not hard which is what i like easy to pick up but hard to master because there are some characters with a star difficulty ranging from 5 to 1 star difficulty so there is something for everyone. But overall i love this game and yes it is 60 bones to cough up for a fighting game but i pre-ordered and still regret nothing its so worth the 60$ and im glad Strive is my first Guilty Gear game because of its lovable characters,BANGER soundtrack,AMAZING graphics and overall fun gameplay if you want a good fighting game to play casually with friends or wanna be more competitive this is the game on the block for you IMO I love this game and plan to put hundreds of more hours into this amazing game along with more DLC characters to play and learn when ArcSys drops them later on!!!

As a returning GG player after taking a break after playing X2 #Reload, I can say that I really like this version.

I can feel the difference between this and the GG I knen, and doesn't bother me. Actually it is best to have this and a past GG games too, so you have more options in both style and characters. Being that I am a big Venom and Bridget fan...i kind of have to right now. 

If you aren't sure because you have too much love for Xrd Rev 2 or Accent Core, wait for a sale on this. Wait to see who gets announced next as DLC. Really all of the lines of this series are good, and different enough to pick them all up. Being that I started this series with the first Guilty Gear on playstation, this series has come a long way...so enjoy what it is.
